comment_reply:
@Buddyw0w most definitely! After the 'break in' period this chair has seriously become my favorite chair I have owned. I have always been into the DX racer chairs but after using the Omega I am hooked on Secret Lab as a company. The quality is amazing and after sitting in the chair for several hours it always looks brand new going back to it's original shape without hurting your bum. 

Side note on the comfort: I always laughed at the thought of people sleeping in their chairs, but after reclining the chair about five notches back from the max up right position (no where near all the way back) while listening to music, I seriously almost fell asleep in it! It's that comfy and with the amazing lumbar and head pillow, it's no contest way softer and more comfy than any support pillows I've used that we're bought separate.

comment_reply: Hey buddy, glad you liked the review! comment:
I recently had the tilt mechanism in my Titan break due to a screw shearing in two. I sent in a video and all the requested photos to the support team and they refused to replace the part. Claiming that the tilt base was not covered by the warranty. Very sad to see a company not stand behind what is an otherwise quality product.

I would not recommend anyone buy from Secret Lab.
Hello sir I have 940mx 4gb graphics card with 8550u i7 15 7000 1.8Ghz processor with 16gb ram can I run watch dogs legion
Just ordered one of these bad boys got one for 69.99$

This chair has a counter-ergonomic design flaw. The seat has an incline up by the front edge. Combined with the firmness of the foam it really badly cuts into hamstrings (bottom part of thighs). This is more than uncomfortable and makes thighs sore and numb as it affects blood flow.
I had watched 5 reviews including this one before I ordered. So I knew the foam is firm. This actually suits me well. The size I chose is a good fit fort me too. But even with the chair set in the lowest to the ground and max tilt forward to reduce the thighs pressure as much as possible, it is hard to bear even over a short period of time.
I'm sending it back and am yet to see how much it is going to cost me.  It is really a puzzle how a chair which such an obvious flaw can have so many good reviews and none mentioning this issue. Wouldn't recommend it.
return shipping cost is on the consumer and costs 133 dollars with UPS ground. Buyer beware.
did the lumbard support do anything? if so what did it do?

I bought this chair based on this review and many others. The 2020 softweave version. It's not a good chair. I will say that overall the seat is firm but comfortable. However the back is firm and uncomfortable. Also the position of the lumbar support is not good and it actually needs a little of thoracic spine support based on its design. The neck pillow is useless because it you use it as recommended it pushes your spine forward to where you can't feel the back support. I didn't have back pain before getting this chair and after using it for 24 hours have new back pain. I ended up sending it back and eating the shipping cost. Very disappointing and sad that it didn't work out and I am exploring other options currently. Customer service was extremely difficult to work with and it took more than a week for them to agree to let me send it back. I was quite frustrated with them. Shipping cost is on the consumer. With UPS it cost 133 dollars to ship the chair back. Buyer beware if you're buying this.

Ordered the Gotham Edition.  Received mine yesterday.  I'm 6'3, 2015 lbs. Today was my first full workday using the chair.  I'd say, I spent 10 hours using it today.   Here's my view on the chair.  Packaging is next level and assembly was easy (one person).  Took me 30 min, and I took my time.  It's really well made and it's very eye catching. Stitching and all that are on point.  Gotta say, sitting in the chair....  Shockingly FIRM!  I mean, sitting on those hard stone park benches firm.   But, and I can't explain it, it's comfortable!  No problems or discomfort all day.  It really supports my back (I have my turned all the way down).  I'm no longer leaving forward, with my back not touching the back portion of the chair.  Any way I positioned it, my back was supported.  Never had a chair do this.  What I like most?  The armrest.  Never realized how low the others were.  It's height puts my arms at the perfect height for working.  The ability to turn them inwards is something I never expected for comfort.

comment:
The genius of this chair is that it goes against what you think comfort is. I've been plagued by back problems my entire life, compounded by a spinal injury several years ago. Any length of time spent at my desk would result in both back pain and what I call "chair fatigue". 
After a month of using it I had NO back pain. None. Not a bit and chair fatigue was non existant. I can sit in that thing for 12 hours plus and I just don't get tired. And this is no fan boying. I've owned so many chairs that I've lost count and they all failed me in some way. But this chair just keeps on giving. 
I love it and my wife loves it. Not only is a delight for her to sit in after a long shift caring for sick and elderly patients but it's genuinely made her a happier person. And I have to admit it made me a happier, more relaxed and less irratible person as well. 
This chair may not give you what you 'think' you want, but it certainly gives you what you need. Gone are the days paying for back treatments, painkillers and any sort of cushion to make a cheaper chair feel comfortable enough to use for prolonged periods. 
Also they are built like tanks. After several months of use the chair looks and feels as good as the day I got it. 
I set up a computer in another room and bought myself a cheaper chair that looked similar. And that was all that was similar. Within days my back was complaining, the arm rests just weren't right and I was napping during the day just to take a rest from sitting. So today I put together a new one and I don't regret a penny I've spent on either of the Titans we now own. Yes it is expensive, but how much am I going to save on back pain treatments? How much sanity will I save now I'm relaxed and my relationship has improved. I know it's crazy to say and probably more crazy to read, but it's the truth. 
Now as to cost. I think of it this way. How long do we spend in bed each day? Now think how much you would spend on your bed. Now take into account that sitting is one of the worst things to do to your back and, for me, the calculation is simple. My back deserves this chair. And if you are invested in your own back lasting the duration of your life then maybe, just maybe you deserve it too.

comment: They should be called Ariana Grande arm rests as you can have them working Side to Side.

"Bucket seats" does not specifically refer to the wings on the sides of the seat, though often bucket seats will have those. Bucket seats are used mostly in cars and shitty gaming chairs where the butt section of the seat is at a lower level than the thigh section of the seat, which increases comfort when you have your feet on the pedals of your car. The titan and most good computer chairs do not have these because they are uncomfortable in a normal sitting position.

At minimum height my sitting is great, I have room on the side and don't feel constrained and I finally stopped leaning forward when using my computer which can't be bad for my eyes and spine.


Buying this was a big expense for me and it wasn't perfect (one of the armrest button was broken on delivery, I need to call them for that) but as of now that chair is pretty much everything I expected (I was worried because the amount of good reviews on their own site compred to outside websites had me suspicious). comment: Not sure if someone else made this comment, but the different weight limit is because it fully reclines. I emailed them about this because my brother is bigger and was looking for a chair and I recommended this one. The company said it will hold up but he could tip over while fully reclined if he exceeded the weight limit, so they cant recommend it to someone over the weight restriction .

I bought my Titan a few weeks ago in the softweave fabric. I'm 6' 1" 260lbs and I have to say after a few weeks I'm not impressed with this chair. For one thing, the built in lumbar support is too high, it should be a few inches lower to support your lower back. Even if I sit straight up it's too high on my back. Second problem is the armrests, they are not comfortable at all and I ended up getting armrest pads to soften them. Worst of all though, I sit in this chair a lot since I work from home and I can already feel the foam under my butt starting to compress all the way down to the frame of the chair. It's like the chair has plenty of foam for the thighs but not enough for the butt. For 400+ dollars I was expecting a little better. I'm not shipping this thing back so I'll probably keep it for a while then give it away.

comment: What kind of desk do you own?

I bought the Maxnomic ErgoReceptor Pro with those exaggerated bolsters in the seat. It also has the cold cured foam that is pretty firm. I ended up returning it in 2 weeks because I thought that was the length of the return policy... I was mistaken it was 30 days with a full refund. I wish I would have ridden out the full 30 days. It was slowly getting more comfortable. I think the issue was the PU leather wasn't giving at all. I say this because I have a new Ram 1500 and I believe it has the same type of foam without the ridiculous bolsters and perforated Napa soft leather  that is extremely comfortable. So much so, that I'm actually contemplating getting one from the salvage yard and retrofitting casters on it and using that as my computer chair.

I have been debating getting the fabric Titan for these reasons but I'm very leery of their return policy with that restocking fee and user paid return shipping. I believe if I had the Maxnomic Ergo Receptor Office it would have been more comfortable because the office series do not have the exaggerated bolsters.

comment: @tech guided What desk are you using?

This chair is hard. The reason it's hard is because there isn't enough cushioning, not because its 'firm'. People saying that it's firm either haven't realized it yet or have been paid by secret lab for their review. The chair looks great but its trash! I've done upholstery work before and had to add cushioning to this chair. You can literally feel where it gets hard, where the foam is bending over a piece of  metal you sit on. Had they added more cushioning to begin with, for a 430.00 chair mind you, there wouldn't be a problem! They could have added another 1" layer easily but it's just another uncomfortable chair. I weigh about 190 and this chair is like sitting on a stone slab.
comment_reply: Jon thanks for the review, but I‚Äôm not going to pay for a chair and then modify it. I am currently very interested in the Noblechairs ‚ÄòHero‚Äô.

comment_reply: @SPHERICAL CHESS After I added some more foam that I cut out, about another 3/4- 1 inch compressed thickness,  the chair is fine. There is enough space if you're strong enough  to squeeze another layer of foam underneath the existing foam that adds just enough in my opinion. The foam they use is cold pressed so it is firmer, but for me I could still fit more foam between that metal plate. There's also straps that run underneath so you can tuck away the rest and you never see it. The arm rests I got some memory foam ones from amazon and they are completely legit now (I believe the brand name was called Aloudy, not the ones with straps, they completely fit over the titans arm rests). If I were to try something else I would try the staples Hyken chair 150.00, or try something from maxnomic. At the end of the day a little bit of modification and thought made it way better for me and I like the look of the chair. Titan cookies n cream.

comment_reply:
Yeah, racing style chairs are a fad designed to appeal to gamers'. As you say, they're designed to keep you in place whilst experiencing external force... not something you need to worry about whilst gaming LOL
Get a posture-oriented office chair.. one that's designed to be sat in by computer workers.. they're more expensive, but healthier, generally more durable, and a better experience overall.

comment: I'm 6 feet, 175 lbs. Have gotten the Omega PU leather for 2 months now. Initially it was really hard and uncomfortable, and I regret buying it. I read online that it takes a month to break it in, so I gave it another chance. Now after 2 months or so, its still hard, but bearable, maybe I just got used to it. The size fits me and is not a problem, the problem is the general shape of the chair. I just cant sit in it that long because it just isn't comfortable for me. The seat back doesn't fit the contour of my spine, the side bolstering of the seat and back is annoying and they should've made it flat. Arm rest gets in the way of the back side bolstering. Overall feel of the foam is just too hard and uncomfortable. Reclining feature is nice and fun to play with at first, but seems more of a novelty the more I use it. Why would I want to recline all the way when I could just go lie down on my bed. No matter what position I recline the backrest, I couldn't find a comfortable position for my back while doing work. The back pillow is useless because it pushes your back too forward. Head pillow has the same problem, but is more bearable. Build quality is superb, and it looks amazing sitting in my room, but if a chair isn't comfortable then its just an ornament taking up space. Overall I'm disappointed in my purchase, and should have just went to office depot and got a traditional computer chair.
comment_reply: xym8744 I'm 5'9 and 150 and my thighs don't have no room to move it feels uncomfortable after a while and i have the omega.

comment_reply: I'm a tad bit shorter than you (5'8), same weight. The Omega is the perfect size for me. The height adjustor lets me get just the right height for the seat. Cushion is firm but after a few days, it seems to soften up slightly (the initial firmness was a plus for me since it will get worn out faster if it's super soft initially). I did get the softweave version because they say it's more pet friendly (can take more of a beating from my cats). The lumbar pillow that's included helps, it's not perfect, but it's way better than not having one there and letting my lower back get sore and tense. I also LOVE the reclining feature, I can adjust the angle depending on the task at hand

I got the omega! People are right, these chairs are really hard. I‚Äôm about 74kg / 177cm or 5‚Äù9 ish. I‚Äôve had it for maybe three weeks or something now. When I first sat in it, although hard, I still feel that it‚Äôs a nice chair but I‚Äôm finding my lower back has been aching a lot since buying this chair and your butt can easily go numb after an 8-9 hour work day that I spend in it. Overall I‚Äôm going to stick with it a little longer because I love the design and it‚Äôs just one of those chairs that welcomes you but if I keep getting lower back pain I‚Äôll either sell it or refund and come the restocking fees. I have the lumbar pillow, for me it doesn‚Äôt help, it pushes you forward too much. If I‚Äôd tried in a store and felt how hard it was I would have been unsure of buying, in saying that I feel it has become more comfortable over last few weeks. Overall you will sweat in chair, I work up stair where it‚Äôs hotter and often need AC to cool me off in it.

comment: I got my titan for a few weeks now, and noticed that my bum is printed in the seat base... is that normal? do you have this aswell?

In case anyone is debating between the Omega or the Titan, I'm a female at 5'3" and 130 pounds, so I ordered the Omega for myself and my husband who is 6'2" 155 pounds got the Titan. Having sat in both, I believe the Titan is more comfortable for me. Something about the way the built-in lumbar support sits on my spine just feels a lot better than the Omega pillow, no matter where I adjust the pillow. It allows my head to rest more naturally against the seat back. The bucket style is also flatter on the Titan and I like to sit cross-legged a lot, so it feels less cramped than in the Omega, where the arm rests cut into my legs and the bucket style edge doesn't leave much room. Originally we thought the Titan would have a much bigger and taller seat back than the Omega, but it's only an inch or two taller, barely any difference. It's slightly wider but the biggest difference is the slope of the seat bucket. So if you're a tall but slim person, the Omega will most likely work just fine for you. My husband sat in it and fit in it just fine. But if you're on the heavier side and don't want the edge of the seat cutting into your legs, the Titan is a must in my opinion. I kind of wish I had the Titan for myself, just for the built-in lumbar support.
comment_reply: Thanks for the info! I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4 at 200lbs - I wanted to be able to sit crisscrossed and was going back and forth between the omega & titan and you‚Äôve convinced me to get the titan :) plus my thunder thighs wouldn‚Äôt love the omega bucket

My husband sat in it and fit in it just fine. But if you're on the heavier side and don't want the edge of the seat cutting into your legs, the Titan is a must in my opinion. I kind of wish I had the Titan for myself, just for the built-in lumbar support.
comment_reply: Honestly, thank you so much for this comment. I was super worried being 5'7 and getting the Titan because of how tall the back might be but you've changed my mind. I'm almost too heavy for the Omega anyways at 225lbs and given your descriptions of how tight the sides are, my thunder thighs would have been in so much pain. Ordering the titan now :)!

comment: In case anyone is debating between the Omega or the Titan, I'm a female at 5'3" and 130 pounds, so I ordered the Omega for myself and my husband who is 6'2" 155 pounds got the Titan. Having sat in both, I believe the Titan is more comfortable for me. Something about the way the built-in lumbar support sits on my spine just feels a lot better than the Omega pillow, no matter where I adjust the pillow. It allows my head to rest more naturally against the seat back. The bucket style is also flatter on the Titan and I like to sit cross-legged a lot, so it feels less cramped than in the Omega, where the arm rests cut into my legs and the bucket style edge doesn't leave much room. Originally we thought the Titan would have a much bigger and taller seat back than the Omega, but it's only an inch or two taller, barely any difference. It's slightly wider but the biggest difference is the slope of the seat bucket. So if you're a tall but slim person, the Omega will most likely work just fine for you. My husband sat in it and fit in it just fine. But if you're on the heavier side and don't want the edge of the seat cutting into your legs, the Titan is a must in my opinion. I kind of wish I had the Titan for myself, just for the built-in lumbar support.
comment_reply: @Gabriella Ly Thanks for your comment. So hard to find comparisons that actually explain things. Also thank you courtney for your info as well!

comment: Sweet Seat! I'll Take one.
Whoever pay me for chair review and higher price than general is an AMAZING chair!
i was set to buy a 200$ chair for the past month, but i saw that gold on black, and i just gotta' have it!

I've owned this chair for about 4 months now and have loved it, mainly because of the adjustable lumbar support. I only tried one other "gaming" chair which happened to have the greatly over exaggerated bucket seat that was mentioned in the video which made it difficult to keep my bag lined up with the back of the chair. I have always had back problems until I used this chair and because of the adjustable lumbar support, haven't had to worry anymore. I also have had paralyzing Sciatic Nerve pain in the past so cutting off leg circulation was a big no no. Luckily I haven't had that problem with the Titan series. My legs are 18" high and there's about a half inch gap between the chair and my legs so circulation is fine. If I needed a few more inches though I have a $20 footrest which raises my legs 3" just in case so it wouldn't be too big of a deal anyways. I'm also 215lb and 6' tall if that helps gauge how the chair might work for you. I generally take good care of my products and don't have any cats that would scratch the PU Leather and as a result the leather is holding up nicely. There's no wear or tear on any of the leather or armrests. This chair was definitely worth the money since I'm sitting the majority of the day. If you have any questions after making it through my huge paragraph then just ask and I'll try to answer.

@Philipp Fischer I've never used a noblechair so I can't comment on that. It's currently spring in Virginia where I live and the Titan does get sweaty regularly so the breathability is not great. I say, that the 400Euros was tottaly worth it!

Any guitar players in here that have any comments about the arm rests?
I am looking for a chair that is great for office use, great for gaming but also great for the music/mixing/mastering studio. It's good that one can remove the armrests, but having to unbolt them sounds very time consuming. But, a lot of the ones that fold up offer no adjustments (not even height adjustments) and that to me is also problematic for office and gaming usage. I'm also a smaller guy (just below 5' 6") and I am worried that the seat's depth (front to back) might cut off some circulation in my legs (pressure points right under the knee in the part that bends, sciatic nerve).
I hate to be that guy commenting asking people for the answers, but I've done so much research and checked out so many chairs that I feel a bit lost at this point. I highly doubt someone who already owns this chair who also plays guitar is going to see this but I figured I might as well test the waters and find out.
Amazing quality, designed and manufactured in America, not cheap tacky made in china stuff, well worth the money.

Secretlabs is invested by the Singapore sovereign wealth fund Tamasek with 200million funding and also providing board of directors to advise on strategic maneuver. comment_reply:
@John Mark Mines Hey, I just received my Titan a little over a week ago, and I can say that the Titan considering my size fits just at the threshold of the minimum height recommendation, so I was lucky. But if you're even an inch shorter, I would suggest the Omega as it will have a more snug fit than a Titan which will be too large for your body curvature to mold properly with the lumbar support and the neck pillow.

But if you already have a healthy back and don't care much about the ergonomics but more for spaciousness, Titan will be a good choice. Personally for me, if I was any shorter than my current height, I would choose the Omega for better long-term posture and back support.

comment_reply: Same height as you, same conundrum as you! I'm leaning towards the fabric, but dirt, dust & sweat, can slowly discolor the fabric. However, the leather could be more sweaty unless you're running an AC whilst gaming. The extra $$ is also a factor for consideration. I was leaning towards the Omega due to the lesser price but same features. Also the Omega logo (symbolic of God of War).

comment: Best secretlab review on the internet. Thanks for making this! Personally, at 180cm I was really doubting which one to choose, but after this video I'm sure the Omega would be uncomfortable at my size.

If you are taller than 5'7", don't make the mistake I did. Do NOT get the Omega. The problem pointed out about the chair hitting the back of your shoulders is a HUGE problem. It doesn't just hit the shoulder blades, it hits the back of your tricep right near your ulnar and median nerves that run all the way down through your wrist. The constant pushing on this area will eventually cause your hand and arm to go numb, which you will assume is just carpal tunnel caused at the wrist area. It's not.
Now this is a honest review, good job

Perfect video, this addressed all of my concerns. Except, one of my biggest concern was comfort. I wished you would've focused a bit on the comfort  and seat cushioning. Based on what I saw, I think I'm going for the Titan 2020. I'm 5'9, 160lbs and could occasionally sit in the chair for up to half a day.
comment_reply: @Aaron Jay Hey Sorry about the slow response. I'm not sure if you've bought the chair yet, and I'm no chair expert, but I decided to buy the TITAN 2020 all black model. So, the first thing that you would notice is an overpowering smell of off-gassing(a bunch of chemicals) but apparently it's harmless and will take a nearly a week to clear with windows open(my room is about 20x8x8). I believe this is also quite typical of better quality memory foam. Now to answer your question,  if you sit like a gentleman at a fancy restaurant with your legs straight out in front and feet planted, knees at 90,  I have a slight gap. But if you sit like that with your legs apart, there is slightly more of a gap because there are 'no corners' so to speak. Comfort wise, I'd say that the seat is as most has described as "stiff" but have gotten used to it and find it quite comfortable. I'd say the overall quality is quite solid and the neck rest comes in really handy. Even tried having a quick snooze a couple times with the chair reclined, not too shabby. Depending on your budget, if you have a bit more cash to burn, it might not hurt to check out some of Herman Miller chairs as well.

comment: 2:39 "Call me by a nickname... "L" desu"

Hi Mike. I just had an ergonomic assessment at work due to my lower back pain that transfers over to my left leg and feet. The OT told me that the reason why I feel numbness on my leg and feet is because I have the back of my knee tight to the edge of the seat. There should be a 3 finger or one fist clearance between them.  See https://www.hrce.ca/sites/default/files/hrsb/Downloads/pdf/HR/OH&S/Ergonomics%20Checklist.pdf. I guess the lumbar pillow is essential if your thighs are short. Anyway, great comparison/review!
comment_reply: Yes, thats very important - I'll tell people that in the future. Thanks Jay!

Im 13 5'5 weigh liek 55 kg should i get titan or omega since ima grow really fast and is softweave or pu 2.0 leather better?
comment_reply:
I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7 and weigh the same as you. I think the titan is very spacious and is built for someone closer to 6‚Äô. Softweave is better long-term, but is not as resistant to stains. The PU leather will ‚Äúcrack‚Äù after a while(probably 2-4 years of use, depending on how you treat it). 
I would personally pick the omega over the titan. But you should consider depending on if you‚Äôre going to grow much taller(hard to estimate) and your sitting positions(as the titan has a wider seat). That being said, there‚Äôs not the biggest price difference.

comment: Gaming chairs are garbage, go Steelcase Leap, Herman Miller Embody or Aeron if you actually care about your back and health.

Some insight into PU leather. All PU Leather eventually peals. Its the nature of the material. I have had three PU Leather chairs, from three different manufacturers (Not secret lab), and all have inevitably started pealing. The average time til the pealing starts is about three years. After the third chair I swore off PU Leather forever and decided to go fabric. The fact that your chair started pealing after two years is not a good sign. This is most likely due to the sweating and hot/humid environment. Both of which can expedite the pealing process. I'm sorry to say that its going to get worst over time. Just for some context, my first desk chair that i ever bought (i currently use as a back up chair), which is fabric, looks as good today as the day i bought it. That chair is 27 years old. To replace my last PU Leather chair, I also went with the Secret lab titan, but went with the soft weave. Awesome chair. When you replace your chair, and i'm sorry to say that you will be replacing it, go with the soft weave. Its comfortable , its breathable and you won't be replacing it in three years. Hope this helps.
comment_reply: I decided to pre-order the NAPA version of the Titan, as they claim it would be a breathable kind of leather; hugely expensive, but hey... only have one back and we've been doing home-working for months now.  I really hope the NAPA will be 'best of both worlds', otherwise it'll be a very expensive mistake :(

comment_reply:
Fracno the primary or intended use of a gaming chair is to be part of your gaming setup, hence "gaming chair". marketed for and used by gamers for gaming.
no one's stopping anyone from using a gaming chair with a "gaming aesthetic", branding and bright colors, for use in the office... except for your wife, your mom, the average small business, and the average corporation.
What's the difference between a keyboard and a gaming keyboard? ...nothing... except all these other things.
one tends to have this or that. the other tends to have that or this
if there was no such thing as a gaming chair, and you said, "I'm gonna get a gaming chair", I'd have no idea what you're referring to. however, since gaming chairs do exist, I'd have a fair idea of what you're talking about, and be able to instantly filter out what wouldn't be considered a gaming chair.
you're not talking about a stool. you're not talking about a $2000 ergo chair, most likely not talking about a chair with a low back, etc.
no?

comment: I want to try one but I‚Äôm scared about the return process

Apparently I have degenerative disc disease in a couple discs in my neck. I‚Äôve been having issues for five years but I didn‚Äôt get this diagnosis until like the third person I saw, and I didn‚Äôt even need to go see anybody until May of this year because somethings suddenly happened and now my neck is seriously messed up. Something happened one Saturday out of the blue and just suddenly my neck has been super messed up now. I was just at Staples testing out about 10 different chairs and it doesn‚Äôt feel like any of them are perfect. I know that I don‚Äôt like the bucket style because I don‚Äôt want things jabbing at my sides. But at least the Titan doesn‚Äôt really have it going on that badly. But As someone who needs good posture, I need to be able to throw my head back and I shouldn‚Äôt be having my shoulders pushed forward like these gaming chairs try to do
comment_reply: Don't bother with gaming chairs if you actually care about posture and your health. Steelcase Leap is awesome and you can always find them used at liquidators for cheap because companies going out of business or leasing new ones will offload all their old inventory and they're built like tanks. Herman Miller Embody or Aeron are also great alternatives to the leap but are usually more expensive. Gaming chairs are for kids to flex on social media to their little friends, adults who actually have to work and have back pain which can cost them money need a proper ergonomic chair.

comment:
This chair has a counter-ergonomic design flaw. The seat has an incline up by the front edge. Combined with the firmness of the foam it really badly cuts into hamstrings (bottom part of thighs). This is more than uncomfortable and makes thighs sore and numb as it affects blood flow.
I had watched 5 reviews including this one before I ordered. So I knew the foam is firm. This actually suits me well. The size I chose is a good fit fort me too. But even with the chair set in the lowest to the ground and max tilt forward to reduce the thighs pressure as much as possible, it is hard to bear even over a short period of time.
I'm sending it back and am yet to see how much it is going to cost me.  It is really a puzzle how a chair which such an obvious flaw can have so many good reviews and none mentioning this issue. Wouldn't recommend it.

No idea why but sometimes I want it lower and sometimes higher. Like the headrest cushion though, we are built differently so cushions can be moved. I've very happy with my Titan SoftWeave Fabric chair. It arrived last month, and have been using it daily for work at home, and gaming at night. It's a very heavy chair. It also feels super sturdy. It's surprisingly stiff. I went with the Softweave for a couple of reasons. First, my last 3 chairs were made with that fake leather material. It feels and looks nice at first. But that lasts only a few years. But it will eventually peel in these tiny fragments. Second, my cats liked clawing and peeling off the fake leather fragments in tiny bits at a time. Think of it like a thick vinyl coating, that when you peel off you have this intact naked cushion. You can still sit on it, but it looks terrible.  So far my cats don't seem to be that interested in this Softweave chair. They act the same towards our fabric couch in the living room. 
It took me about 20 minutes to assemble the chair myself. All the tools you need are included. Although I had a minor issue that the left side of the chair does not look like the left side pictured in the 1 page instuctions, nor the video. "Why does it look different? Is it missing a bracket?", were my initial thoughts. I emailed their tech support, with pictures and got a response within 12 hours that all was normal. They just need to update their video and 1 page to show the correct left side of the chair. I guess that part of the design got updated recently.

That said, I'm still super happy with this purchase. My 2 gripes are; 1 it is expensive. And, 2 the logo and lettering on the chair is a bit tacky. But you get what you pay for. And I can live with the logo and lettering. Glad to hear your chair is still holding up after 2 years.

comment:
Yo, I also had this chair for 2 years. I got the all black PU version back in sept 2018. My room is always dark and usually cool. I don't really sweat much even on this chair. My leather has held up rather nicely over the years, only a few wrinkles here and there. I saw some peeling on this guy's chair, and knew what happened when he said that room didn't have AC. Don't get pu leather if your going to sit in such an environment as this was also a problem in a lot of south east asia places. I just triple checked my chair, there is no tearing leather like yours, and a good chunk of my free time is spent on this chair.

My one complaint would be the older model's armrests being wobbly af from the plastic parts over time, but it seems as if they fixed that in the 2020 series. Another small complaint was that my bony butt felt slightly uncomfortable at the way back of the chair due to less foam on that side, and I offset this with some back pillows. That really is more of the nit picky things though, overall I'd say it does justify the $399 price, however, it's not packing any further value. If this was $499 i'd say not worth but it's priced pretty good for what the overall experience has been for me. No pains from sitting so much over the years unlike my previous el cheapo chair (couldn't sit longer than 30 min before pain).

comment: gaming chairs are pure garbage

I've had my SecretLab chair for about 2 years as well.  My back pains I've had are gone now too.  It is definitely a nice chair that I do (for the most part) recommend.  I would most definitely suggest the Softweave over the leather chair for almost anyone.  My roommate has one model from SecretLab with it and it is definitely amazing and more my style.  The only gripe/issue I've had in my 2 years with the chair is that a tear started happening on the inside of an armrest.  It has now about two inches long.  I reached out to customer service but this isn't covered by the warranty.  I would have to pay to replace the armrest.  That experience left me a little sour since it isn't as if I took a knife to the chair.  I don't have pets.  Haven't moved since owning it.  It just...happened.  But it isn't covered and that's disappointing.  I will say newer models have a different armrest (looks and feels better) so hopefully no one else will have to experience something like this.  But this has left me a bit sour.  For work, I went back to my mesh office chair and that has definitely been nice.  My next chair, whenever that is, will likely be in that grain of thought.  But no regrets with the SecretLab.
comment_reply: @Shirotsu Yeah that was the reasoning they provided via email when I had submitted the request.  Still a bummer given that I only had the chair for two years and that is considered "wear and tear."  I still have another chair from 2013 with leather armrests and it is a-ok.  It is what it is.

comment:
I just made the dive and picked up a 2020 Titan with the "SoftWeave" cloth. I do not regret it at all. Very glad I went with the cloth and I think it would fix your sweating problem if you could go back and change which chair you have now. It definitely supports me better than any chair I have had previously. I'm short for the Titan but I weigh too much for the Omega and it works out well.
I actually really like the head pillow, it's very comfortable and being able to move it around helps a lot. I kind of wish the Titan came with a lumbar pillow. I couldn't get the adjustable lumbar support to work well for me so I'm using a pillow. Will probably get a nice looking memory foam one sometime, but right now it's the same one I was using in my old ratty chair...
Glad I'm not the only one who sits in odd positions in their chair. :)

First of thank you for your service with the Army, great video! I think I'm going to go with the Titan soft weave and subdued logos as much as possible. Thanks so much for taking the time to make this video have an awesome day!
nothing is better than Herman Miller aeron period

I've got the same chair and where i sit, behind my knees has peeled and the same spots as your chair too and I never cross or tuck my legs either. It's the PU leather itself. The new stuff is meant to be far harder wearing supposedly and that's why they implemented it. 

I'm actually chasing us a reupholsterer up at the moment as the bum part has separated from the inner foam (In part thanks to my cat and his bloody claws) with some cat scratch peeling. I've also ordered some self adhesive PU leather from Amazon (for cheap) to stick ontop of the bum part if the upholsterer is too expensive. 

The base costs $136.40 AUD from secret labs as well with the new material.

And that's the best part about these chairs, you can get stuff fixed and it won't cost you an arm and a leg to do so!! 

I love my Titan and I especially love the stitching and branding all over it compared to yourself. I think most of us do but personal preference as you said. 

I'll update with the outcome of which ever 3 ways I went to repair the base (bum part).

Maybe this can also be a solution for other owners of our model and be a cheap and high quality fix for them as well moving forward!

comment: you should try the ergochair 2 from autonomous its hands down better than most chairs in its price range unless you buy a used herman miller

If you are going to buy a chair either go with a fabric based chair with a mesh back or a top grain leather.  PU leather is a terrible product and will flake away.  Also people think PU leather must be taken care of like leather when in fact you are breaking the polyurethane away causing cracks and flakes.   Cloth, mesh, or top grain.  Never get PU.  If your on a budget then wait another month and save more.
comment_reply: @I never read replies My many years in the furniture business indicate that I am correct and his chair is starting to show flaking at the seams where he sits.  Why do you think they had a leather option but it was more pricey?  Calling "PU leather" leather is like calling a piece of paper a tree.  Technically your right about it being made of wood, but your body is mainly sitting on polyurethane (which is also the reason he sweats in it.  Top grain leather hase pores in it and can breathe vs PU.)

comment_reply: I do plan on making an ergonomics video and in that video I'll cover foot rests, but until then I can give you some quick basic info on this subject. You want your chair to be high enough in relation to your desk  so that your arms rest at a comfortable position as opposed to shrugged up and tight. When you use your keyboard, it should be as if its sitting in your lap. When your seat is high enough to do this, your feet may not touch the ground so a foot rest can help with this. It allows your feet some support and you can usually move them up and down to maintain some circulation. Does this kind of answer your question?

comment_reply: I bought the MyoChair and returned it - willing to bet the ErgoChair 2 has similar issues given the overall shape. If you're looking for something that'll keep your back straight and upright, the ErgoChair won't do it. The lumbar support is really nice, but there is no upper back support. I found it worked better with a desk that had a keyboard tray, but I don't regularly use one, so it definitely wasn't for me. The angle it forced me to look at when leaning back in it was too high vs. where my monitor was. Just some fair warning - they have 30 and 15 day trials in the US and Canada respectively. Keep your original box or otherwise you can't refund it.

I've been using a Secret Lab Omega (stealth) since early 2017, so over 3 years now. And I have to say, I'm looking to upgrade to an actual ergonomic chair. The foam on the seat definitely does not soften up over time, it's as firm now as it was day\week 1 (I'm ~185lbs). The leg fatigue is very real. The only way I survive in this thing 10+ hours a day (been WFH since 2016), is with the lumbar pillow & head pillow, plus I had to add a memory foam foot rest a couple years ago. The build quality is definitely solid, it's survived multiple moves w\o any tearing, fading, or any degradation of quality at all. However, if you want an actually comfortable chair, I'd steer as far away from a "gaming" chair as possible. Currently looking into the Autonomous ErgoChair2 as replacement.

These chairs are bad. I own similar one from Maxnomic. Only thing good is that the frame will last. 
* PVC leather imitation started to peel off in few years. 
* You can see that the back rest is straight, it will not support your back well. 
* The seat cushioning will lose firmness and in short time you can feel the frame construction seen in 4:13. 
* The hand rests are rattling like hell.
These gaming chair companies are heavily investing in marketing and looks. For most of the buyers the 300$+ price tag is a big expense so they are likely to defend their purchase. In reality, you are better off with a random office chair that suits you and that you can try in the store and which costs 1/2 the price .

I use it just about everyday. Is it a super comfortable end game chair? No, absolutely not. Would I recommend someone spend all this money on this chair? No. I think it's built well and I expect that it will last for many years but, if I could do it again I would've definitely just bought a nice office chair and spent the leftover on headphones or samsung b-die ram or something. It's a nice chair and out of these type of chairs I think SL are at the top (especially because they offer non pleather chairs) but ultimately it's just as comfortable as the seats in my car and they're nice too but, they'll never be my favorite seat.
comment_reply: @Moshi Mic Yeah something like that would definitely be better. I've seen others recommend those chairs before and I hear they're excellent. I still have the Titan and it's still holding up really well. It's not that I totally hate the chair. I guess I just think they went too far on their race car bucket seat inspired design. It definitely does support very well. I have no back pain at all from the chair. At the same time though I'm in no danger of experiencing a 200mph crash while sitting at my PC so some softer cushions wouldn't hurt that's for sure and I stand by my previous comment. If I were buying a chair right now I'd probably get what you're looking at.

The SecretLab chairs have good quality materials, and the stitching is top notched. You hear this in all online reviews.


What you do not normally hear, are experiences from a non-youtuber using it for more than 6 months. The chair is firm, too firm, if you will, and does not soften over time. So sitting on it for more than an hour will get your butt hurt literally. I find myself shifting side to side in discomfort, as the seat is too hard. I ended up softening the seat with an additional cloth cushion so I get more hours on the chair. I hear this reviewer mentioning this issue too. A cushion will help.


The lumbar support is fine, but the support and height are not for everyone. For shorter users, it supports them at the right part of their back. For me, at about 179cm height, it seems to support the top of my hips more then the arc on my back. I stopped using it. So do be careful if you are near or above the recommended height.


The arm rests will loosen over time, and start to move about. Not a big issue, though I would thought the mechanism will hold out longer.


I have not tried other gaming chairs before, so I do not know if the above issues relate particularly to gaming chairs but to me, the purchase and price point are not worth it. I can easily circle through a few cheaper, more comfortable chairs with the money and with money left over.


In summary, great materials, good craftsmanship but just not a comfortable chair to use.
comment_reply: @DGneoseeker1 The backrest has a bit of give, and I can adjust the side level to change the angle now and then so I am fine with it. The seat however, nothing can be done with it except to cushion it. Which totally goes against why I bought this $400 bucks chair to begin with.

comment: BRIONY should stop pretending for youtube views

I've had a SecretLab Titan for a few months now and it's great. As this review says, it is a little firm. It's not the most relaxing thing to sit in, but it is supportive, particularly when you're at your desk for long periods. The Titan looks basically the same as the Omega, but it's a little bigger and therefore designed for taller and/or heavier people.

Two minus points for me: first, the height-adjustable arms could do with some sort of fixed points so that you can easily set them both at the same height without guessing or (yes, I've done this) measuring! Second point was that my chair wasn't level after assembly. I ended up unscrewing the "lower" side of the base and putting some rubber washers in as spacers to level it up. You shouldn't have to do this on a premium chair, though.

Those points aside, I've found this to be a nice balance between cheaper "ergonomic" chairs and the much higher-price options from the likes of Herman Miller. Definitely good value!

comment: I had the 2018 model Titan Stealth. I just got the Pu leather 2020 version, some complaints, the biggest is the leather isn't as good as the 2018, the 2018 is thick leather that has zero imperfections, even after 2 years it looks like I just took it out of the box. my 2020 model has creases in the pu "leather" it also has more slack in the leather, air in-between the pad and the thin leather sheet of "leather" they used. also I sat in it and felt it was smaller, I took out the tape measure and the 2020 model was just shy of 1/4" smaller, measuring the middle of the pad. Also, creases and even small wrinkles where the stitching meets for each sheet of leather they used to get their shape, on mine mostly on the backrest where stitching meets. If you have never had a secretlab before, you might get this and think nice chair, but it's nothing compared to the 2018 model. I am a critic, and I couldn't find anything wrong with my older one, I think they are finding ways, and materials to make them cheaper yet selling for the same price, Myself, I wished they just charged $80 more and made it the right way.

comment: I just ordered one then started looking at reviews. I'm glad to see so many people enjoying. Looking forward to replacing my old hunk o junk chair that I'm pretty sure is slowly killing me.
comment_reply:
@Valmerix 
They totally employ shady review/marketing tactics for sure.  


I've got one now, it's a decent chair for sure, especially compared to my old one. I will say that they offer a 5 year warranty in exchange for a social media post with a picture, which I put on twitter that I hadn't used in years, and haven't used since. They even followed up asking for additional photos so they could use them on their own platforms and they'd credit me. I declined to follow up with them about it because I'm not a) hard up for attention b) I paid them good money for the chair, if they want me to produce marketing material for them they can pay me. 


As far as office chairs go, I'm sold. You can easily spend 1k+ on a herman miller (I've got one at work and it just seems like a chair to me) or you can spend 90 at office max for a piece of junk - which I've done on multiple occasions. For ~$300 this chair is comfortable, super adjustable, and looks nice. It seems like it should last a while. Overall I'm pretty happy with it.

comment: Just my comment on this chair -- got it a month ago after watching this review. The thing to remember is that chairs are pretty unique to people I think, because for me it's extremely uncomfortable; in particular, because the seating is very firm and the outer edge is raised, it pushes up against my knees/lower thigh and blocks blood flow to my lower legs which causes pain after a while and I suspect is actually really unhealthy. Now I guess i can't fault Secret Lab for not making a perfectly universal chair, but the thing to keep in mind here is that unlike buying from a store I have no options to return this chair. So I just spent like $500 and I can't even use this thing... and can't return it. Will try to sell it maybe it will be comfortable for someone else. From this experience though, I would not recommend buying this chair at all.

I bought my Titan 2020 a few weeks ago in the softweave fabric. I'm 6' 1" 260lbs and I have to say after a few weeks I'm not impressed with this chair. For one thing, the built in lumbar support is too high, it should be a few inches lower to support your lower back. Even if I sit straight up it's too high on my back. Second problem is the armrests, they are not comfortable at all and I ended up getting armrest pads to soften them. Worst of all though, I sit in this chair a lot since I work from home and I can already feel the foam under my butt starting to compress all the way down to the frame of the chair. It's like the chair has plenty of foam for the thighs but not enough for the butt. For 400+ dollars I was expecting a little better. I'm not shipping this thing back so I'll probably keep it for a while then give it away.

comment_reply: Warwid Honestly, I have no clue what people are talking about when it comes to ‚ÄúSitting on rocks‚Äù I find it really comfortable, you dont sink into it and its not super plush but its because it gives your body the support it needs, if you get a super squishy chair sure it might be softer but after a while it starts to feel like youre sitting on a board and your back starts to ache. Ive had a lot of gaming chairs and this is by far the best one ive ever owned and recommend it fully to anyone looking to invest into it. Another thing is the foam they use in Secretlab chairs is a material (Cold cured foam) thats built to last and not break down over time, most chairs on the market use the typical plain old foam that ends up breaking down and disintegrating into dust leaving you with a sad excuse of a chair. If you have a little extra money, Secretlabs is definitely worth the investment.

Cant recommend anybody a gaming chair in this price range. They arent good for you have really bad quality and are far to expensive for what you get. I had many gaming chairs for example, Maxnomic, DxRacer, Secret Lab and Noblechairs. All had the same build with different foams and leather or fabrics. Mass produced shit which looks good. Small things like the lumbar support sound great but arent when you keep in mind a lumbar support also needs to be one the wright height and the wright force. Finally i bought a chair from a local german manufacture. I recommend everybody to a) buy a good normal chair for the same amount as the secretlab. Much better for your back.
Or b) look for high quality gaming chair makers when you want the looks

comment: I have to ask. I am considering buying the Titan chair, but Im so uncertin since all of the bad reveiws that secret lab has recived. And at this point people are either super unlucky and only the angry people leave reviews, or this is the most advanced scam I have witnest in my life and I just dont know XD Can someone share their feedback on the Titan chair with me? ^^
comment_reply:
I think the issue is when it comes to chairs, there is soooo much subjectivity in terms of comfort. Everyone has different needs. It's just like a mattress, some people find firm mattresses to be atrocious, some find them to be the best thing on the planet.

I'd say the main thing to consider is the seat. Chairs at this price and quality are not going to have the softest seat ever. We know that super soft seats and beds tend to be very bad for posture and back. Unfortunately, the majority of people assume higher quality = softer, so when they receive the chair, they get a firmer seat and think it's really uncomfortable or cheap. 

For some, this chair may be truly uncomfortable, but for most, I think it's the best you can buy. It does have an adjustment period, but after probably a bit of use, you will never go back to another chair.

I have a secretlab chair.
Here‚Äôs a quick review for mine. I have the secretlab OMEGA. I love it. I will sat in it almost everyday for the last 6 months and I have only run into one issue. When reclining, the locking mechanism is broken so it will keep reclining to a certain point. After spending hours of googling, I haven‚Äôt found anyone else with this issue so if you see this, I wouldn‚Äôt be too concerned. Lastly, the customer support isn‚Äôt the best I‚Äôve seen.

Comfort 4/5 
a bit more firm that expected, but still great for longer sessions (8-12hrs)

Durability 3/5 
(very durable, mine just broke so I put this any higher, otherwise it would be 5/5)

Functionality 5/5

Customer support 4/5

Price 4/5 a bit pricey but worth it.

Overall 3.6/5

edit: I changed a rating for customer support because after the website‚Äôs customer service bot wasn‚Äôt working correctly, I was redirected to their email team who were very helpful and were people and not bots! They were very helpful and sent me a replacement part which should be arriving tomorrow.
comment_reply: Good to know customer service is responsive... I hope so.

I currently have a DX Racer Zero that is about 5 years old and just started flaking.  From listening to you my doubts about brand and type have gone away
comment_reply: @iKnowRealTV It seemed to attract more dirt than my old DX Racer did due to the suede parts, but the suede  part is comfortable.  Initially I was extremely happy with the chair and the assembly (more of an experience than just a chore).  Then after sitting in the chair for several days I was ready to ship it back as the seat was what I perceived as significantly harder.  Where the DX Racer would not give me any pain on the butt even after fifteen hours I was extremely sore after this amount of the time with  the Titan.  I contacted support and they  said there is a break in period and I have to agree.   I am liking the char at this point, but somewhat miss that feeling of 'enclosure' that the DX Racer would give me.  Only time will tell.  Even with my doubts the chair is well constructed and a value for what you get.

comment: 2 short for a titan

For me, i have the DXRacer 'racing' black cloth version, the seat base is hanging to the left, gas piston sinks in after 2 years, back support is really bucket seat type so always rounded shoulders...

I just Pre-ordered the Secret lab titan, cookies and cream cloth version and i think i will be very happy with it. They actually put the specs on the website for their gas piston so i believe it will last,  and i can see they are proud of their work.. i have seen how nice the cloth version is on the omega with a microlens so the cloth nicely done. the construction looks good base and everything.
comfort and the head pillow is actually useable soft enough. The DXRacer pillows are always way too hard and useless for competetive gaming. Also the secret lab has a wider seat and is not too narrow of a bucket seat type so if you have wide shoulders it's still comfy. Secret lab has done it way better design wise too not going all the cringe gamer route and added some class to their chairs.

 I feel like dxracer was a good buy 2/3 years ago but secret lab is a step up in quality.
comment_reply:
@Vincent Yes that's very true all PU leather will crack over time and if you take good care of it it will last longer but also when it's very hot outside you will start to sweat in your chair because it doesn't breathe very well can make it crack too all the moisture hot/cold/hot/cold it will crack and flake.
 You will be happy with fabric very easy to clean :)

The Secret Lab Omega Elite 2018. Is by far the best chair I've ever used hands down!! Outside maybe the Steelcase office chair. 

Which are twice as much but not nearly as comfortable for long excursions. The Titan is not in the same league here.  As the Omega Elite series however. 

But I can understand why most people haven't tried it out considering it's quite spendy.  Furthermore I agree with others though.  

You need to get chairs that fit your size, weight & frame. The E-Blue Corbra, Cougar Armor & some VetraGear chairs I find good for smaller builds. 

The DXRacer series are designed for smaller frames typically as well. 

So it's not a surprise it might fit others a bit better who find the Secret Lab to large. DXRacers are way to tight personally for me.

 I also don't feel there anywhere as comfortable as the Secret Lab or some AK Racing chairs.

However you're not going to find a better built more comfortable chair for larger users almost anywhere. Then the Secret Lab Omega Elite series from SL.

They are clearly the best gaming PC chairs on the market this year for big & tall users. For it's $700 price tag might be a bit much. 

But the Omega 2018 you can get into around $500. Not bad considering everything that you get here. :b

At first I also jumped on the guy for being nit-picky. But I just received my XL and I have the same problem as him. One leg of the base is beat to hell, with deep gouges in the powder coating, that left a razor sharp edge right where you rest your foot when sitting on the chair. In his video it doesn‚Äôt seem like a big deal, when it‚Äôs not your chair, but after paying $500 and waiting two months you don‚Äôt expect such a large defect, and he‚Äôs right for being upset over it. Particularly because they made him pay for shipping.

Now I‚Äôm having to go through the exchange process, we‚Äôll see how it goes. But no way am I paying for any shipping or additional parts. Either they back their product and make it right, or I‚Äôm doing a charge back for defective product. I expect them to ship me a new base, with a return label for the old base, that would be the right way to handle this...let‚Äôs see what happens.
comment_reply:
What? Where did you hear that a chargeback is ‚Äúillegal‚Äù? It‚Äôs part of everyday life, if you‚Äôre not satisfied with a product or service, and the company won‚Äôt handle the situation correctly to make it right you have the right to file a chargeback. 

I‚Äôm not even talking about all the fraudulent chargebacks that happen on a regular basis to scam sellers out of products. The credit card companies are way more on the side of the buyer than the seller. 

You can chargeback really at any point after the transaction, it especially helps if you have records of communications with the seller regarding any issues you had, as proof that they‚Äôre not handling the situation correctly. In my previous comment I stated that I‚Äôve reached out to them to give them a chance to handle the situation, and only IF they Don‚Äôt do the right thing would I consider filing a chargeback. Now technically I could‚Äôve just don‚Äôt one right away for a defective product, but I don‚Äôt like not giving them an opportunity to fix the problem first.

Since my last comment they have gotten back to me and sent me two replacement bases. The first one arrived damaged again, with the box damaged and one of the legs of the base poking a hole in the box and sticking out of the box, because of that it was damaged to hell. So they sent me a second base, which finally arrived in one piece with no damage. But since I haven‚Äôt put the chair together until I received the second replacement base, after which I also noticed that the armrests are not even when looking straight at the chair. One armrest is slightly further out then the other, even though when looking underneath the seat they are both attached the same way on their adjuster sliders. So technically a second defect, that I haven‚Äôt decided what to do with yet. I need to figure out if the difference in position is a difference in actual armrest base lengths or are the screw holes under the chair seat just offset incorrectly. So I will be doing some measuring to figure it out, and will report back.

Nice chair. Have seen a lot of reviews for the Secretlab Omega today. I need to replace a Steelcase chair that had great reviews but I never found comfortable and causes hip and upper leg pain. The Omega will be high on my list!

BTW, be sure you maintain regular medical attention on the cervical disk problem. About 20 years ago I began noticing a bit of numbness in my fingertips. An MRI showed major disk degeneration between my C4 & C5 vertebra. Eventually had surgery on it. That helped until 2 years ago, when I suddenly lost much of the feeling in both hands. This time it was the C6-C7 disk degeneration with major compression of the nerves that fed to my hands. Had a second major surgery on the spine, but there was enough permanent damage to the nerves that my right hand still has a lot of numbness and I can no longer touch type. Just wanted to pass on to stay on top of it and get to specialist immediately if you begin having tingling or numbness in hands & arms, trouble holding on to objects and frequently losing your grip on them, you can't hold a pen or pencil, etc. You want to catch it before permanent damage can set in.
comment_reply: THANK YOU very much for commenting and sharing your experience. I was wondering if repeated compression would cause permanent damage and it sounds like it does. I'm going to do physical therapy for it soon and see afterwards if surgery is necessary. I'm thinking that it is. What type of surgery did you get if you don't mind me asking? it seems like there's several options and i'm seeing new stuff come up.

comment: Do you think it's worth the money to buy if you already have an okay gaming chair? Cause I've been thinking about getting one but I don't know if it will be worth it
comment_reply: @Kyruto If it's not really bothering you and you don't feel any discomfort when you sit in it then yeah, maybe you should stick with it. Yes, the secretlab omega is definitely on the expensive side. There's a lot of great gaming chair options on Amazon though for pretty reasonable prices. for sure this is one of the most comfortable chairs i sat on! My friend had a Secretlab Omega but with the softweave fabric instead of the PU leather and the second I sat in it, I was deadset on getting one. It feels much better than an ordinary gaming chair. There's really small details here and there that make the difference. Like right now i'm typing this up and my elbows & arms on on the arm rests and they are comfortable. Firm and durable material but with some give to it. The foam is comfortable. Idk man I can go on but there's a lot of great things going for it. It's expensive but I think it's worth the $350+.

When you say "okay" gaming chair, is there something lacking? like is it not comfortable or what's the deal? if it's doing the job, i would stick with it personally. My previous chair WOULD NOT hold me up. At first, I'd have to adjust the height back up daily but then it got worse and i'd have to adjust it multiple times a day. Besides that, it was worn out. I love the Secretlab chair. I think it was obviously a little expensive but it was a good investment because i do spend a lot of time gaming and on my computer for other productivity stuff. A good chair has an impact on your body and health 100%!

comment_reply:
Hey Mochi! Thanks for the comment! That‚Äôs a good question! I‚Äôd think you‚Äôd probably be fine with the lumbar support. Thinking about a smaller person using the Titan, I really don‚Äôt see it being an issue, I just think the overall height of the chair will just go over your head. I‚Äôd say as a plan B if you‚Äôd want support & the lumbar support isn‚Äôt helping, you just order an Omega lumbar pillow & use that instead. comment:
The genius of this chair is that it goes against what you think comfort is. I've been plagued by back problems my entire life, compounded by a spinal injury several years ago. Any length of time spent at my desk would result in both back pain and what I call "chair fatigue". 
After a month of using it I had NO back pain. None. Not a bit and chair fatigue was non existant. I can sit in that thing for 12 hours plus and I just don't get tired. And this is no fan boying. I've owned so many chairs that I've lost count and they all failed me in some way. But this chair just keeps on giving. 
I love it and my wife loves it. Not only is a delight for her to sit in after a long shift caring for sick and elderly patients but it's genuinely made her a happier person. And I have to admit it made me a happier, more relaxed and less irratible person as well. 
This chair may not give you what you 'think' you want, but it certainly gives you what you need. Gone are the days paying for back treatments, painkillers and any sort of cushion to make a cheaper chair feel comfortable enough to use for prolonged periods. 
Also they are built like tanks. After several months of use the chair looks and feels as good as the day I got it. 
I set up a computer in another room and bought myself a cheaper chair that looked similar. And that was all that was similar. Within days my back was complaining, the arm rests just weren't right and I was napping during the day just to take a rest from sitting. So today I put together a new one and I don't regret a penny I've spent on either of the Titans we now own. Yes it is expensive, but how much am I going to save on back pain treatments? How much sanity will I save now I'm relaxed and my relationship has improved. I know it's crazy to say and probably more crazy to read, but it's the truth. 
Now as to cost. I think of it this way. How long do we spend in bed each day? Now think how much you would spend on your bed. Now take into account that sitting is one of the worst things to do to your back and, for me, the calculation is simple. My back deserves this chair. And if you are invested in your own back lasting the duration of your life then maybe, just maybe you deserve it too.
comment_reply:
Mr Thornton thank you very much for the amazing input! I‚Äôm very happy to hear your feelings on the chair and couldn‚Äôt agree more with you on the quality of it. It‚Äôs def a chair that‚Äôs built for needs. 
Hope it continues to serve you & your wife many more years of comfort & reliability! 
I‚Äôm going on year 3 and she‚Äôs still holding strong!

comment: Just got a 2020 omega DVA edition chair and I absolutely love it quality is amazing and comfort is honestly better then all the other options out there
comment_reply:
@Warwid, I think that is everyones concern. The material Secret Labs uses is called a cold cure foam. Its very firm so that it can hold its shape over long periods of time. Im still  using the same Titan chair from this video, my chair is going on 3 years old, I still love it very much, and feel comfortable in it even after all these years. 
Some desk/gaming chairs use very cushion like seats where over long periods of time they wear down the cushion & you're sitting on compact cushion that feels like you're sitting on the metal/plastic plate of the seat under the cushion. 
Its firm but comfortable. I'd say check over more YT or try and fine other streamers on Twitch to talk w/ about it.
I've had probably 5 people who have purchased through me who followed me on Twitch who are also streamers who have given me great feedback of they love it. (Darkman, Birbasuarus, Faded Sevens are some of them)
Hope this helped

comment: Their customer service is a joke. Their "fulfilment partners" lost the parcel, then they were looking for it for 2 weeks. comment:
Don't know if you're still active on YouTube or not but let me give you some advice on HeadSets.
Look into the Phillips SHP9500 Headphones and grab a V-Moda Boom Pro Mice if you just have to have one. With your sound setup now, which sounds damned good by the way, I don't think you need the Mic but if you just want one on your head it's a very nice Mic. The SHPs are Open Back but trust me unless you crank the volume far above anything comfortable, I'm an old dude who grew up on Metal and Hair Bands so trust me I know Loud and Comfortable, you want get any Mic Bleed from the Headphones. Look into them they've gotten rave reviews for years from the Audiophile Community, the ones that aren't snobs and are hands down the best headphones you can get sub $100 US. Right now NewEgg has them for $69.99 shipped. There are the SHP9500 and the SHP9500s don't worry both are just as good but I prefer the SHP9500 the original version. Both can be driven by most phones/devices but really, really come alive with a decent DAC/AMP. Outstanding Headphones as far as Sound Stage/Positioning/Sound Quality. Not the super Tinny High End but more than enough to hear every footstep and know exactly where it's coming from. Realize this is a year late but hopefully you still see and look into the SHP hands down best Headphones other than the PC37X or the HD580X Jubilee from Seinhieser that I've ever used and honestly it's a toss up between the 3 with the 37X at $120 or so and the HD580X at $150 on Drop, (used to be MassDrop). Hope that helps and thank you for the follow up on the Titan, I'm leaning towards it with the Soft Weave Fabric as my new chair once my Old Ass decides to finally pull the trigger...
PS.
God Bless you to young man...
comment_reply: WOW! thanks for the good tip dude! I'm still good on a headset at the moment, but ill keep this in mind for the next pair I get! Thanks :D

comment:
Titan PU Leather is the best among them, sure is pricey, but worth it not only in the long run but also less regret.

Pros: 
Water resistance, 
Easy to clean/wipe over with water, 
Built-in adjustable lumbar support, 
Worth the money in the long run, if looking after properly, 
Warning: Might sleep often in the chair as a backup bed, 
Perfect in wintertime or air-con room temperature.

Cons: 
Too pricey, 
Hopefully will not crack over a period of time, depending on the weather you lived in and the room temperature combining with body temperature, 
It might damage if by accident scratch over a sharp object, 
Get warm faster in the summertime, especially the bump (better get a breathable cushion [fabric] for this as separately to breath, easily without waiting too long to cool down) or use air-con in the room.

I'm getting one already, just waiting to be made pre-order the Batman special edition to arrive in. Thank you for the review after one year, it surely helps a lot.
comment_reply: @Cloud Strife awesome dude!!! Glad you love it! I havnt heard about the Dark Knight chair yet, so thanks for following up w/ me!

comment: Thanks for the review! My Titan is being delivered tomorrow and I'm a bit anxious. I'm 6'3" and around 250lbs so I wanted a chair that fits. I saw so many reviews of people 5'7" ish and I started to worry it was going to be too small. Can't wait to try it out :D
comment_reply:
@Jonathan I would say it's still pretty stiff compared to any other leather office chair I've had in the past. I'm sure it has softened up a bit though and to be honest I've gotten used to it anyway. I still get a slightly sore back every once in a while if I sit weird and touch on a spot in the lumbar support I'm not used to. 

Overall I'm still happy with the chair though. I love being able to just unlock and drop it back into basically a recliner and watch TV, etc. The build quality still seems great, no issues at all.

comment: I am currently a college student and was looking for a good all around chair for school work and gaming. I would definitely use this chair for hours a day. The only thing would be for summer break I would have to disassemble the chair in order to transport it back home. Basically I would have to disassemble and reassemble the chair 2-3 times a year for transporting to and from college.  Would you recommend the titan for my specific situation or should I wait till I‚Äôm out of college? Thanks
comment_reply:
It wouldnt be very fun. A bit of hassle but you could do it. Probably just to save the trouble I'd say maybe wait. 
You would have to use the mini little tool it comes w/, or get your own allen wrench set to take off the arms & the hydraulic from the base of the chair. All assembled it is kinda heavy, you can move it by yourself but its awkward & heavy. I've moved it a few times myself already. 
If you do it just for when you go home for the summer & when you go back to school, keep the instructions & think of keeping the tool handy/get your own allen set. If your planning on breaking it down more than that for home vacations/small breaks. wait.
But for going home for the summer & school. You could break it down.

comment:
Really enjoyed your review!  Nice and blunt, also good to know you didnt get 'gifted' the chair so totally unbiased :)   

My own chiar broke a few days ago after about 6 years hard use (4 - 8 hrs a day) so i cant complain, but I am looking at the Titan as a replacement, but its right at the top of my scale price wise and worried it wont match my short ass body.  The inbuild lumbar (however you pronounce it! lol) suport really has me sold though.  

It seems all the other 'gaming chair' alternatives all have those strap on cushions which IMHO look more of a problem / i wont bother to use them after a few weeks... (take note manufacturers!).  I also think a lot of them have the shoulder bracers which might be great for those of a slim build, but I have quite broad shoulders as an ex swimmer, would probably push my shoulders forward rather than 'hug' me...

I also looked at the Noblechairs ICON and yes, lovely looking, good quality, and great reviews, but no in built lumbar support other wise i would stretch to their asking price. At first I also looked at a cheaper alternative and narrowed it down to a GT Omega Pro, that seems to have all the same specs (steel frame, cold formed foam, etc) just lacking the internal lumbar support but it was only ¬£200... so that is my second choice... The only worry I have about the Titan since i come in at the short ass range of 5'8"-9" and 'medium build'....  Would it fit me?

(I'd give you a weight but seriously the batteries on the weighing scales have run out... honest.... Reading this now looks like im having a laugh but seriously, you couldnt make this up :D)

So medium build.... a Robert Downey Jr, just slightly more love handles?   Anyway....  

Seriously leaning towards the Titan, I might be on the shorter / lighter end of their scale but now and again i like to cros my legs and take all concideration of my posture out of concideration... which the smaller chairs probably wouldnt allow, I also eat kebabs at my desk and (god forbid) drop some chillie sauce on my chair (so fake leather FTW!).... But;

Do you or the folks here have any experience with this chair who have a similar body size...?

Thankyou again for your review,  good watch!

Q.
comment_reply:
@Qpid Stunt so happy you're liking it! Thank you so much for the very in depth feedback dude! May you game comfortably! ;) lol
Thanks again with the follow up!
